132121.content:
Weeks later, the Heck Family had finally done it, after waiting what felt like an eternity, they had been given the 300 Million Dollars they were promised on that faithful day.

Frankie (of course) got her many 'I told you so moments' with her family, as all of them had doubted her when she bought the tickets. Her neighbor Nancy tried to give Frankie as much advice on what to do with the money as possible (most of the advice was articles that Nancy read in the past).

Mike gave it a lot of thought, but he decided to quit his job. Wanting to be private, he gave his reason as 'he received a large inheritance that would allow him retire early.'

Axl, by comparison, was quite boisterous about the lottery winnings, informing anyone and everyone about it, and being given a large amount of praise from all of his friends.

Sue initially only wanted to tell her friends about the info (who gave her screams of joy), but after Axl had basically shouted to the whole school about it, she had many popular girls try to get close to her and invite her to parties, obviously only trying to get close to her for her money (much to the oblivion of Sue).

Brick was just attending class with out much difference, he simply wanted to do work and didn't feel it mattered if he mentioned the money.

The sheer joy that could be felt be the family as they accepted the money was immeasurable. They wanted to celebrate, and after Nancy had suggested the idea, Frankie knew she had to do it.

"Whoa, Frankie are you sure that we can eat all of this?!" Mike asked to his wife, as their kids looked in amazement at all the food that was on top their brand new and much larger table. "I've never seen so much good looking food in one place, it's beautiful." Sue said in wonder. Axl was practically drooling, and Brick could stare at the sight.

Frankie responded to her husband's concerns, "Don't worry Mike, if there's any food left, we can just put it in our brand new fridge." Frankie pointed at the family's gigantic fridge. The house in general was remodeled a day in advance, mostly because Frankie wanted the feast to go as smoothly as possible.

The family sat themselves and began stuffing their faces in what could only be described as a mini buffet. Mike & Axl went straight into the meat, ripping through it like starving wolves. Brick tried a bit of everything, but still went through the food as well as a boy of his size.

Meanwhile, Frankie & Sue went primarily through all the sweets and baked goods they could find. Sue had a small amount of doubt, thinking about how having dessert before the rest of the food wasn't right, how she had worry about her braces not getting damaged, and how this could have a negative effect on her health, but after that first bite into that chocolate cake, she just couldn't stop stuffing her face with that food.

Frankie probably had the least self restraint out of everyone, she scarfed down pies to cupcakes to even an entire cake. She wanted this more than anyone, having raised a family may have brought her a lot of joy, something she missed when she had more money was just eating sweets, something Frankie had to do less if it meant feeding her family.

By the end, although there were left overs, the family had pigged out to the max. Axl and Brick may of had the least complaints (Axl because he was an athlete and had to eat bigger portions before, and Brick because of his smaller size), but the rest could not say they were as lucky.

Mike had to unbuckle his pants half way through the meal, and when he was done, his stomach was slightly swollen, almost spherical looking, and he was groaning in pain. After finishing, he immediately when to his bedroom and crashed into bed, falling asleep.

The rest of the family got ready to go to bed, wanting to sleep away the food. The boys went through the motions with out much trouble, going to sleep quite quickly.

Sue, on the other hand, was voicing her concerns to her mother, "I loved the food, but what if I get cavities? That could seriously hurt my teeth for years. What if I get stuffed in my digestive system? Sitting on the toilet for too long is bad for you. OH GOD! What if I get fat after all this? I ate so much junk food and no vegi-" Frankie finally interrupted her daughter, "Honey, don't worry about all that. If you brush you teeth, you'll be fine. If you make sure to push it out fast, you'll be fine. And you won't get fat, this won't be every day, it was just a celebration for winning the lottery, OK?"

Frankie had successfully comforted her daughter's worries. Said daughter was the third hardest in terms of pigging out (behind her parents), her stomach was swollen, but it didn't stick out as much as her father. Frankie gave Sue a kiss on the forehead and said goodnight.

She entered her bedroom to see her husband snoring. She went up to a mirror and inspected herself, and it was obvious that if who ever ate the most in the family was a contest, she would of won. Frankie's stomach kind of reminded her of when she was 4, 5, possibly even 6 months pregnant with anyone of the kids.

She went into bed next to her husband and found her mind wandering, mostly to what Sue had asked. Would they get fat, it was something kept her thinking, that maybe this money wasn't a good thing, that maybe the power would get everyone's head the family would get fatter and lazier. Frankie found it so difficult to imagine herself at Nancy's weight, or even bigger. A giant belly hanging in front of her knees with extra wide hips and thighs, not to mention how her face would pudge up and grow extra chins.

No, this type of pig out would only be this one time, it was for celebration, no more... but it felt so good, not just the food, but Frankie actually enjoyed the feeling of being stuffed to the max, there was something so good about it. OK, she thought to herself, we can have a extra big breakfast in the morning, and that would be it. Frankie just had to tell herself, this money would only bring good things to her family, nothing else.
132121.title: The Pay Day Celebration!

choices: She begins to work her cooking skills to the limit (Food Quantities Increase)
Renovate the house, maybe even hire some staff (Laziness Increases)
1321211.content:
Frankie woke up early (unusual considering she preferred sleeping in and letting the alarm clock annoy her to wake up). Frankie took her night gown off, looking into the mirror reminded her of her lingering thoughts from the previous night. Her food baby bump of a belly had finally disappeared, leaving the feast she had consumed digested. Frankie checked herself out to see any immediate damage from calories, but it seemed that her body was more or less the exact same as last night (what she didn't know was she had put on an entire pound from a single meal).

After putting on some comfortable clothes, she went into the kitchen, remembering the idea she had the previous evening. She pulled out of the fridge many of the half-eaten cakes/pastries from the family's feast. Frankie also got out ingredients to whip up some pancakes with bacon, but these weren't your standard pancakes with bacon. Winning the lottery had let the Heck Family being able to afford some of highest quality food the town had available.

The bacon was enormously fatty, at a price that Frankie never thought she would be ever able to buy. The pancakes were made with whole, creamy milk and butter that was unbelievably good to Frankie when she gave it a taste test (it was also unbelievably calorie ridden, unbeknownst to Frankie). Frankie had to admit, she wasn't the most fond of cooking, especial this early in the morning, but there something fun about it this time around.

As she was getting out the high quality maple syrup, Frankie gave it some more thought on why cooking was fun now. Maybe it was the fact that cooking before always left her frustrated because it always felt like the family was losing money when they ate, it always felt like Frankie had to choose between making nice meals for her family or have money for more important issues like college and health. But now, they had more money than they knew what to do with.

Frankie was preparing the kids' lunches around 7:00 am when the rest of the family finally woke up. What Mike and the kids didn't expect when they got of their beds was alluring smells of fluffy pancakes, sizzling bacon, and the pastries of last night. No one even bothered to put on their regular clothes, the rest of the family walked into the kitchen in their pajamas.

"Frankie, what is that wonderful smell?" Mike was pleasantly surprised by all of the delicious looking food the table was covered with. Frankie gave a smile, "Oh this? I woke up early, so I decided make the family an extra special breakfast." Mike walked over to his much shorter wife gave her a small kiss on the forehead to show his gratitude, even if it was with his trademark stone-cold face.

Axl walked past his parents and started to dig into pancakes. "Holy Crap, Mom! When did you learn to cook?!" Axl said to his mother, all while having his face stuffed with simmering bacon. "I've always known how to cook, I just never had the time or money to really show off my skills." Frankie replied. She took a seat at the table, deciding she too wanted to start devouring some left over cake with bacon. Brick simple said morning and began to eat, not really questioning anything.

Sue gave an excited squeal and when she saw all of the tasty looking food, but then, for a second, she remembered the feast from last night and her worries on growing fat and unhealthy from pig-outs began to creep up again. That was until Mike gave a hearty pat on the back. "Come on, honey, don't you want to have this breakfast your mom made for us?"

Sue took a seat next to her father, and after taking a bite of her pancake, her worries completely vanished. After a speedy scarf down, all the food from the table was inside of the stuffed stomachs of the Heck family. The kids were driven to school, all them having lunch bags that looked quite a bit bigger than usual.

While Mike may have driven the kids to school, Frankie stayed home. As she was the person who did win the lottery, it was decided she would have the majority of control over the money (although the rest of family did have some sort of say over the 300 million dollars). She wanted to spend some of it on something, but was puzzled on what, that's when it hit her:
1321211.title: Beginning The Day (And Gluttony) With A Bang!

choices: "Yes, we'll do it." (Continue with this storyline)
"No." (AKA, I want to do a different storyline)
132122.content:
It was just another lazy Sunday in the Heck Household. The family were all scattered, all entranced by their own amusements. That was until a knock could be heard from the door.

"Coming, give me a second." Frankie shouted, walking over to the front door in her pajamas. She was expecting Nancy or another one of their neighbors to be there when she opened the door. Instead, she was greeted by a young woman with a few camera men at her side, and a van behind them with a satellite on the top. Needless to say, Frankie was confused by this.

"Umm.... and who might you be?"

"I'm Madeline Bow, and I'm here to announce you were selected for our show!" Her voice was full of an infectious enthusiasm.

"Wait, I'm confused. Why were we selected for this?"

"Someone in your family submitted you and everyone else for the chance to be the stars of our show, and we decided you would be the best! Did they not inform you?"

Frankie looked behind her, the rest of her family looking at the door in curiosity.

"Okay, which one of you put us down for some 'chance for a tv show?'"

Mike just shook his head, obviously not being the one. Brick also gave it no thought and said he wasn't the one. That left Axl and Sue, who were both in deep thought. That was when Axl snapped his fingers.

"Oh yeah. I saw something about stardom, filled out the form online, and pressed send. I guess I'm about to be nationally famous!"

The rest of the family were in disbelief about Axl's relaxed manner about this, but they knew the teenager didn't really care about anything but his own personal image, so they accepted it. Frankie looked back to Madeline and said,

"Come in, I suppose. We can talk about this whole show deal."

A few minutes later, Madeline was sitting at the Hecks' messy table, looking over some contracts and papers that she brought with her. Frankie brought over cups of coffee for the both of them.

"So, do you mind me asking what this show is about?" Sue asked, growing a little excited about the prospect.

"Oh, did your brother not tell you? This show will follow a lower to middle class family, like your's and millions all over America, and show them the effects of an unbalanced diet has on their bodies over the course of a year."

"Wait, what? Does that mean..."

"Yes, you'll be gaining weight essentially. Won't it be great?! We believe this could lead to a large awareness being spotlighted on the dangers of unhealthy eating!" Madeline's bubbly continued, even when telling the family this revelation.

Mike looked at his oldest son in bewilderment. "Why did you apply us for something like this?"

"Look, their website said nothing about getting fat!" Axl defended himself, only for Madeline to quickly retort.

"Yes it did. Multiple times in fact. Did you skip through all of it?"

It didn't surprise the rest of the Heck family in the slightest if Axl had overlooked that glaring detail and focused on the stardom part.

"Look, we had a few other families apply, so I won't mind if you decline. But I should mention the benefits of doing the show."

She handed a paper to Frankie and Mike. It detailed how much money they would receive for doing this. They were in awe.

"How? How can it be this much?" Frankie asked in disbelief.

"The network is expecting this to be a big success, myself included. By the end of the year, if your family have met or exceeded our plans, this will all be yours. We will also cover all food expenses you have for the year, and cover any expenses involving your growing size. This includes clothes and even furniture if that becomes an issue." Madeline cheerfully explained to the parents.

"This is good, but what about the kids? What do they think about this?" Frank asked out loud.

"I do my research before scouting. Let me talk to them real quick!" Madeline walked over to Axl first.

"You play football, correct? Besides fame, you can consider this as 'bulking up'. You don't have to stop being on the football team, just a change of practice!"

Axl seemed to get the memo. "Right. That doesn't sound too bad! Mom, dad, sign the papers already!"

Madeline then faced Sue. "Sue, I've heard you deeply care about others, and want to make a change. By doing this program, you'll be making the whole country learn of the evils of an unhealthy lifestyle!"

"I don't know about this." Sue still looked extremely worried. "I don't feel like this is a good idea..."

Madeline put a hand to Sue's shoulder. "Sue, by doing this show, you can potentially save lives. And when it's all over, we can help you lose the weight if you so want. What do you say?"

The teenage girl still didn't look 100% assured, but seemed better about the idea. "Okay.... I'll do it."

Finally was Brick, who immediately told her, "I don't really care about getting fat. As long as I can keep going to school and stuff."

Madeline gave him a thumbs up and looked at the parents. "They all seem fine with it. All that's left is you two."

Mike looked conflicted before facing Frankie.

"I'm not sure what to say. This money would be life saving. It would let us retire at a good age and leave the kids well. Frankie, I'll let you have the final say."

"Me?"

"Yes. If you're okay with this whole thing, I'll get as fat as they want with you and the kids."

Frankie thought about the idea of putting on weight. Not just winter weight, but from the sounds of it, getting seriously obese. She thought about the kids, and how this would effect them. In the end, she said...
132122.title: The Chance for Reality Television Stardom

choices: "Mike! Seeing the strong and stoic dad get fat will be great for viewership!"
"Frankie! You are walking charisma! The viewers will love a fat, dedicated mom!"
1321221.content:
"Perfect!" Madeline said ecstatically. "This absolutely perfect. Would you mind if we begin as soon as possible?"

"Umm." Frankie looked a little dumbfounded. "Don't you think we should dress a little better, maybe clean the house up some?"

"No, no, it's fine. This show should capture realism. If this is how you live on Sundays, then this how we shall record you! Just give me a second to get things ready."

The next few minutes were dedicated to contracts being signed, phone calls Madeline had to make, and camera being set up all through out the house. After everything was ready, Madeline got a microphone, and told the family to get ready. Filming would begin any second now. The family were nervous, but some were a little excited.

"Hello, my name is Madeline Bow, and I'm your host for 'Fattened Family'. This show will follow your average American family. Although, they may not be so average now a'days. 35% of Americans are obese, and that number continues to grow every single day. This family are primarily healthy, many can be described as fit. But what if we changed their life styles? What if made them, potentially, more like you? For the next year, this family of 5 will be given a specialized diet more comparable to what you may be eating. We shall watch them grow unhealthy, unfit, and just get down right fat. Why? To give America the wake up call it needs with its obesity epidemic! Now, let us meet the family."

Madeline seemed much more calm and professional when in front of a camera, when compared to the nearly hyper woman from before. First, came out Mike. He seemed a little awkward about being in front of camera, but kept up his stoic expression.

"Hello, my name is Mike Heck. I'm a middle aged father of 3 and I work at a quarry."

Mike was obviously followed up by Frankie, walking with a smile.

"Hi, I'm Frances Heck, but you can call me Frankie. I'm Mike's wife, and the mom of our 3 kids. I work as a dentist assistant, and I hope you enjoy the joy." She tried her best to be positive, but she was still finding the idea of getting fat off putting.

Axl was next, having all of his usual swagger and ego.

"Yo America, the name's Axl Heck. I'm in my last year of highschool, and yeah. You'll get to know me great!"

Sue stiffly made her way, choking up in front of a camera that show her to the whole country.

"H-Hi. My n-name is Sue H-Heck. I'm in my second year of highschool. I hope that the weight I put on makes you realize that e-eating bad f-food isn't g-g-good for you."

Last was Brick, who walked nonchalantly into the room. "Hi, I'm Brick Heck. I'm in middleschool."

Madeline walked back in front of the camera. "Looks like their all here. To begin, we shall take photos of them along with taking their current weight and height."

The cameraman walked away. Madeline approached the family. "Hey there, good job so far! I love your different personalities, the audience will need different styles of people to gravitate to. Sue, your awkwardness was adorable! I can already tell you'll be a fan favorite!"

"Really?! Wow, that sounds cool..." Sue seemed to enjoy the compliment.

"We'll take your measurements and whatnot off screen, that will be given to the audience in editing. But before that, I wanted to talk about something. Most shows need a main character, someone we can focus on most of the time in between other characters. I was thinking it should be one of the parents of the family. Don't get me wrong, teenage obesity is a massive issue, but adults have it even worse. After seeing you two do your introductions, I have decided it will be-"
1321221.title: Soon to be TV's Fattest Family

choices: A mountain of greasy fast food, more food than the family could of ever imagined
Still a lot of food, but less, and it looks somewhat gourmet
13212212.content:
"Me?! Are you 100% sure about this?"

Madeline placed her hand on Frankie's shoulder. "Frankie, you'll do amazing. I know show biz, and I know you're our best choice."

Frankie looked over to her husband. "Mike, is this fine?"

"Frankie, I feel you would do a better job than me. I'm not exactly someone who wants a camera on his face all day."

"O-Okay. I'll do it. I'll be the show's lead."

"This is getting better and better! Now, let's get those darn photos and measurements. Staff!"

The show's crew walked in, taking each family member to a private area. Each family member changed into clothes that showed off their bodies. This meant grey shorts and grey exercise crop tops. The men looked a bit more awkward in them, being much more fitting on Sue and Frankie. That said, they all understood why the choice. They would probably wear these again, now showing off their fattened waists. Sue felt extra uncomfortable about showing herself in the outfit, but after some encouraging words from Madeline, she did the poses needed for the photographer. Next was the measurements, which would be showed on the show.

Frankie: Height-1.58 meters (5'1")/Weight-105 pounds (47 kg)
Mike: Height-1.96 meters (6'4")/Weight-202 pounds (92 kg)
Axl: Height-1.71 meters (5'6")/Weight-148 pounds (67 kg)
Sue: Height-1.60 meters (5'2")/Weight-112 pounds (51 kg)
Brick: Height-1.42 meters (4'6")/Weight-99 pounds(45 kg)

"Okay!" Madeline exclaimed. "That's your current info. With that, we can truly begin the show's premise."

"And that is...." Axl asked.

Madeline pointed with tons of energy at the dinner table. While the photos and data were being collected, a pile of food was placed on the table. A cloth covered said food.

"I hope you all are hungry, because your first meal on 'Fattened Family' begins.... NOW!"

She threw the cloth off, revealing.....
13212212.title: Fattened Frankie, our lead!

choices: Hours later, they must go through the struggle of dinner.
The following day, work and school begins for the new stars.
132122122.content:
"Wow, this looks wonderful." Frankie exclaimed.

"Smells great too!" Axl remarked.

"Hmm." Brick looked slightly confused. "I thought this show was about the average American's life style. But this food looks much higher in quality than what the 'average American' would normally have. Why is that?"

"How observational of you, Brick." Madeline approached the boy. "That is, to put it bluntly, because we have advertisers. We can't exactly show exact brands and have them shown in a bad light. So, to make it easier, we will prepare all of your meals. Now, there is a catch...."

Sue became worried. "A catch?"

"Yeah. You're sort of contractually obligated to finish everything we give you per meal. And we mean EVERYTHING."

The Heck family was stunned by this revelation. The amount of food on the table at that very second was like their usual lunch and dinner combined. And now, they were expected to not just finish it, but assumingly also have a dinner just as big in a few hours. It was daunting, to say the least.

"It's to ensure peak calories intake, along with no food going to waste. I would recommend beginning now, dinner is in 6 hours!" Madeline's comment was somehow both cheerful yet ominous.

The members of the Heck family didn't seem to have another option. They walked over to the table that was covered in what you would expect from a fast food place, only if they were made by a 6-star buffet. Chowing down on hamburgers and fries while slurping down soda. One thing was for certain, this food was delicious to the Heck family. No one could deny that the food was to die for, and a far increase in taste to what they were eating before. Axl was going into it fast at first, but as he grew more full he was slowing down. Sue and Brick were taking a slower approach, as they knew it would be best for digestion. Mike started slow just like his youngest children, but began to ramp up the pace as the meal continued, quickly being matched for the fastest and hungriest. Matched because Frankie began fast and kept it up the whole time. As the supposed lead, she felt the obligation was on her shoulders to gain the most. It was hard to describe, she still wasn't a fan on gaining weight, but as this was for her family, she felt that it was in her best nature to do her absolute best for everyone.

It took around half an hour, but the family had finished the large first meal. Madeline walked over and began clapping.

"That was absolutely amazing! You all did fantastic! The shots we got were great. Make sure you get some rest, let that food digest because soon, dinner will be followed up. Normally, I would tell you to walk it off, but that might burn some fat, and we don't want that. Do we?" She let out a giddy laugh and made her way back to the crew.

The family could barely move, but eventually they walked over to some more comfortable places, specifically their beds. There were burps and groans from everyone in the Heck family. Mike and Frankie laid together, staring at the new installed cameras in their room.

"Oh, Mike. What have we gotten ourselves into?"

"Frankie, don't worry." He cuddled his wife and her swollen stomach. "We're doing this for the best. And who knows, maybe dinner will be easier."
132122122.title: Food Fit for the Sponsers

choices: 15 days later, it's the first weigh-in, and their still not used to it!
15 days later, it's the first weigh-in, and they've gotten better!
1321221222.content:
Dinner was not easier. In fact, it was worse. The portions were bigger than lunch, leading the whole family to practically pass out after their meals.

The next morning, everyone slowly got out of their beds. Even if they were being filmed at all times and eating unhealthy, enormous meals, they still had their lives. As such, school and work were now on their minds. Once they were changed, Madeline gathered them to the central room of the small house.

"Good morning! I hope you all slept well!" Madeline's cheerfulness didn't end, even in the morning. "How are you all feeling?"

"Sluggish..." Frankie groaned.

"Tired...." Sue yawned out.

"Can we please have 5 more minutes in bed?" Axl complained.

Madeline quickly ignored Axl's question. "Glad to see everyone is starting to get used to the effects of eating such a diet. Trust me though, sooner than later you'll be used to it. Anyways, I've got a question."

Brick raised his hand. "Do we get a prize for answering correct?"

Madeline pondered this. "I guess you could say you're getting a prize. Though the question might be a bit too simple." She revealed even more food on the table. "Who's ready for breakfast?"

This got a groan out of the family. They sat themselves down and began eating, all of which was at a bit of a faster rate thanks to the fact they have work/school to get to. While they ate, Madeline spoke up.

"Oh, before you ask. We called into your places of school and work. They know all about what's going on and are 100% okay with it!"

"Really?" Frankie spoke up, mid chewing a pancake.

"Yep, we simply had to explain to them that it would be good advertising, being featured on national television and what not. We'll also be breaking up our crew somewhat to your locations, so make sure to play nice with them. I might even make a visit to your locations every once and a while to say hi!"

After finishing the taxing breakfast, the family all got up and made their way to their car. Frankie and Mike made notice of how some mini cameras had been placed in their the night prior. The kids were dropped off at their schools, Frankie was dropped at her dental office, and Mike parked the car to head into the quarry. It was a unique experience for the family, considering they were now being followed by camera operators from now on. Some places were even fitted with mini cameras, like Sue and Axl's lockers or the dental office's place of work. On Mike's end, his co-workers were curious about this whole tv show, but once Mike explained it, they all moved on and acted professional. The case was also true on Frankie's end, though occasionally it was odd talking about it to a waiting customer. The kids had it especially odd. Brick's classmates were all eager to ask about the people following him, but he simply answered in quite nonchalant ways in his usual Brick style. Sue wasn't taking the new found attention the best in her quite awkward way of handling problems. Her friends at least were there for her, even they themselves were confused by why Sue was doing this whole fattening up premise. Axl was relishing in the glory of being followed around by a tv crew. His pals were all on board, getting him hyped up. The first day outside of the cameras might be considered normal.... until lunch break came around for all of them.

The tv crew handed each of them a large box containing another massive, fattening meal. They each knew they didn't have a whole lot of time to eat in their respective locations, so they all hurried. After an agonizing 30 minutes to an hour (depending on the family member), they were done. These lunches made them sluggish in their work for the rest of the day. Some more hours past, Mike picked up Frankie, they picked up the kids, and they all got back home. They all seemed to generally recover slightly from the lunch, though it was still taking a tole on their bodies. Madeline was waiting for them indoors.

"So...." She asked in her perky voice. "...how was lunch? I hope you enjoyed it!"

Sue let out a groan. "I couldn't focus on math class afterwards...."

Madeline let out a chuckle, giving Sue a pat on the back. "No worries. You'll get used to it sooner than later. Speaking of which, dinner will be hot and ready in 2 hours, so get mentally pumped for it!"

The family collectively groaned. It was too hard to believe this was real. Frankie could only pray that her and the family would 'get used to it' like Madeline put it.
1321221222.title: The New Everyday Life of our Stars

13212212222.content:
2 weeks had passed, and the shock of being followed by a tv staff all day was beginning to fade. Everyone in the Heck family's life had accepted this as reality and the world went on as normal. The struggle continued to be the meals, with their large quantities. That said, it slowly began to get better. The constant influx of burgers, sausages, pizza, and just general meat and carbs began to sit better and better with the family, even if was still daunting for their bodies to handle. By the end of the first week, the sluggishness of their bodies after meals began to wear off and they could keep working on their responsibilities with much more keen focus. And by the end of the second week, it was now routine. The Heck family would wake up, finish their massive breakfasts, lunches, and dinners with as much ease as the old days before the change in diet.

The family returned from school and work, Madeline waiting for them as usual. Her cheerful attitude occasional got on some of the family member's nerves at the start, but most of if not all of them had grown to be okay with Madeline in general.

"Hello everyone! I've got exciting news for you all. Want to guess?"

Mike spoke up. "Let me guess. You're increasing the amount of food we have to eat now?" He spoke with a dry sarcasm, still not being a huge fan of this show's premise.

"No no. Not one bit!" Madeline held up the grey crop tops and shorts they wore at the start of the show. "It has now been half a month since we began coverage of the show! Every 15 days or so, we check in on your progress. So let us begin!"

The family knew it would happen sooner than later. They all went into their private areas and got changed. They all came out, looking a bit fuller each.

"Let's go in the order from last time. First, Brick!" Madeline did some jazz hands, much to the amusement of no one, not even her fellow staff. Her never ending joy seemed very much like her own personality trait, nothing else.

Brick came up to the scale and stood on it. He came out at 108 pounds, and increase of 9. Being the youngest, he was destined to gain the slowest. He didn't look too different from last weigh-in, except just looking a little less like skin and bones. "Welp," The young teen said. "that was an expected result.

Madeline let out a clap. "Glad to see you taking it well. Now, our next weigh-in is Axl!"

The young man got on the scale. He was shown to now be 156 pounds, thus an increase of 8. His legs looked skinny as usual, but mid-section and arms looked just a tad bit fluffier. "Woooo! Let's go! Bigger the better, right?" Axl let out a cocky grin.

"Indeed so, Axl! Finally for the kids, we have Sue!"

Sue slowly got onto the scale, looking somewhat nervous. She was shown to be 124, an entire 12 pound increase from last time. Sue's limbs saw no difference, but her chest and stomach certainly looked quite a bit more plush. It's hard to tell if her chest had officially gone up a size or not, though that could change. "Oh wow. I wasn't expecting it to put so much."

"No worries." Madeline walked over. "It just means you're doing a better job than your brothers, that's all!" The woman gave Sue's mini belly a light tap, which caused Sue to blush a little before walking away. Madeline looked back to the family. "Now, Mike!"

The older man walked onto the scale. It displayed he was now 214, a 12 pound increase like his daughter. The weight didn't look too bad on him compared to his fellow family members, thanks to his massive height advantage. That said, it was clear where it all went, his mid-section. Mike had a certified gut now, some might even call it a beer belly. It was noticeably plusher, and could lead to a decent grab of it. "Well, I guessed as much. I've got to make my belt less tight just so I can fit into my pants."

Mike got off, meaning there was only one left, Frankie. Madeline didn't need to say anything, only give her a thumbs up.

Frankie got on the scale, less so than her daughter but still noticeably nervous. The displayed number came as a shock to most in the room, as it displayed her as 119, meaning the middle aged woman was now 14 pounds heavier than she was at the start. Thanks to her short stature, it was quite easy to see where it had gone. Her mid-section was a bit fluffier, now she could pinch her stomach with the fat there, but most of it was from the waist down. He legs now rubbed against each other when she walked, and her butt was chunkier, making it a very tight squeeze on the grey shorts from last weigh in.

"Wow, Frankie. Excellent job!" Madeline gave a fist bump to the air. "You're doing amazingly as our lead role, keep it up!"

On one hand, Frankie was disgusted with herself for letting herself go this much. On the other hand, she felt oddly proud of how she was taking the job. She wasn't normally congratulated on most things, so being told she being a great sport made her happy.

Frankie: Height-1.58 meters (5'1")/Weight-119 pounds (53 kg)
Mike: Height-1.96 meters (6'4")/Weight-214 pounds (97 kg)
Axl: Height-1.71 meters (5'6")/Weight-156 pounds (70 kg)
Sue: Height-1.60 meters (5'2")/Weight-124 pounds (56 kg)
Brick: Height-1.42 meters (4'6")/Weight-108 pounds(48 kg)

"Thanks Madeline. I'll keep it up."

"That's great to hear. Because you'll want to keep it up." Madeline let out a smirk.

"Huh, what do you mean?" Sue asked.

"Simple, Sue. You might of noticed how your clothes might be getting too tight for you, and if not then sooner than later it will begin to happen. As such, we'll be paying for new clothes you might need. Sounds great, right? Well, that's not all we're paying for you guys..."

Axl let curious. "And what might that mean?"

"Between each weigh-in, I'm going to give you fellas a challenge. Some might be cooperative, some might be competitive. When won, our studio will provide wonderful prizes for you!"

Besides Mike, this got the family a little excited. Madeline continued.

"This week will be cooperative. You have 15 days for the next weigh-in. All you have to do is collectively put on....."
13212212222.title: Weigh-in #1! Bigger Bellies!

choices: Thus, we skip to the next weigh-in to see the results.
We slow down to follow one of the Heck family members and how they're doing.
132122122221.content:
"Wait, 60?!" Frankie exclaimed. "How do we do that?"

Madeline gave a comical wag of her finger. "Collectively, you guys gained 55 pounds. All I'm asking is you literally do what you did these past 2 weeks.... but more!"

Mike spoke up. "But assuming you aren't increasing portions, how will we do that?"

Madeline gave a fast response. "Simple! Just eat more, do less. Whenever you can take the lazy way out, like taking an elevator over the stairs, for instance. Your stomachs are getting used to the food as well, right? That means snacking between meals is also viable! Just make sure to always do your best!" Madeline attempted to pump the Heck family up, give them some much needed motivation.

The Heck family gave each other some looks, unsure if this would be for the best. Even if no words were said, they all knew that a new TV would be amazing to have. Frankie simply gave a nod to Madeline, who looked ecstatic.

"Dinner is in 1 hour, have fun!" She walked of the room, leaving the family to begin the next 2 weeks of gaining.

And thus, the Heck family began their next major step into inevitable obesity. They had all be avoiding dessert after dinner considering how large the meal was, but this time it was different. After their large stuffing (that night it was spaghetti and meatballs), Frankie went over to the fridge and pulled out cookie dough and a tub of ice cream. They began eating through it as well, passing around the sweet and cold treats. Not long passed before that too was finished, the Heck family collectively rubbing their bloated guts before heading to bed.

Because the Heck family no longer had to buy their main meals, this gave them an extra sum of money. The following day, Frankie used this surplus of cash to buy a metaphorical ton of snacks and possible dessert options. This was cut between family members, some opting to have large stashes than others. After the weekend, it was noticeable how the Heck family was eating even more than before to their co-workers and classmates. Whenever they had the chance, a Heck family member would open a bag of chips or chew on a chocolate bar or just generally be chomping on something at all day. This even began to annoy some of the people around them, as they simply wanted some peace and quiet from the constant wrapper noises. When they got back home, the snacking would stop, but something new was added. After dinner, the family would gather around the TV with all of their sweets and begin some more eating. It was a constant cycle of eating at all times. Naturally, this lead to something they were all expecting.

Clothes began to rip and tear. First was of course Frankie, who casually while at work at the dentist office heard a large ripping noise. She checked a mirror and saw that her pants now had a hole, showing off a portion of her panties. She was dying of embarrassment the rest of the day. It wasn't long before Mike had his own incident, having a button from his shirt pop off, showing off his growing gut. He couldn't feel luckier that none of his co-workers were there to see him, as it was the end of the day.

The kids didn't fair much better with their own wardrobe malfunctions. After football practice, Axl had found that his shoulder pads and jeresy thanks to his growing waist and hips, leading to his teammates to get a good laugh out of his discomfort. It became ever so common for Brick to show off the edge of his tummy when he stood up as his shirts got ever so smaller. And Sue almost had a social break down when she had to stretch for gym class, only for her bra to snap off, falling to the floor.

Needless to say, the Heck family's wardrobe was getting smaller by the minute. Luckily, Madeline and the TV crew were there to help. Anytime they needed larger clothing, they always had an exact replacement of the clothing in a bigger size, or multiple sizes larger if requested. At first, many of them were quite ashamed of themselves for asking for bigger clothes, but ultimately even the most stubborn family members recognized that this would be needed if they were going to continue on the show.
